stepAnswer: $$\sqrt{1-t^2}$$ is not defined as a real number when $$t>1$$.
stepTitle: Explain what is wrong with the following integral: $$\int_{1}^{2} \frac{1}{\sqrt{1-t^2}} \,dx$$. Select the correct answer.
answerLatex: $$\sqrt{1-t^2}$$ is not defined as a real number when $$t>1$$.
choices: $$\sqrt{1-t^2}$$ is not defined as a real number when $$t>1$$.
$$\sqrt{1-t^2}$$ is not defined as a real number when $$t<1$$.
